definition: reference book consisting of material quoted from many sources, arranged by category (about 600 of which were compiled between the 3rd and 18th centuries in China)
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: In the official history, encyclopedia belonged to different classifications between Han Dynasty and Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 在正史史志目录中，汉宋之间类书所属归类不同。

sentences.english: Jian Ming Yuan was compiled by Yuan Nian who was Buddhist monk in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《兼名苑》是唐代僧人释远年编纂的类书。

sentences.english: The bookstore doesn't handle medical books.
sentences.chinese: 这家书店不经销医药类书籍。

sentences.english: Two of the most popular non-fiction books of two thousand ten were about rock and roll stars.
sentences.chinese: 最流行的非小说类书籍两千十两名关于摇滚明星。

sentences.english: Now of such books as this I mean to say nothing.
sentences.chinese: 关于这类书我真没有什么话说。

sentences.english: Read career exploration books for insight into careers you might enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 读一下职业教育类书籍以了解你可能喜欢的职业。

sentences.english: I'm afraid I'm not into that of books.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我对这类书不感兴趣。

sentences.english: I lomm-e this type of book.
What was the last great non-fiction book that you read?
sentences.chinese: 哪一本书是你最近读过的最好的非小说类书？

sentences.english: It is a page-turner and is the most attractive non-fiction book I've read this year.
sentences.chinese: 这是我今年看过的非小说类书中最引人入胜的一本。

sentences.english: Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint.
sentences.chinese: 阅读保健类书籍时要小心，你可能死于错误印刷。

sentences.english: He’s the author of four books on database development and numerous articles.
sentences.chinese: 他是4本数据库开发类书籍及数篇文章的作者。

sentences.english: It's worthwhile reading books on popular science.
sentences.chinese: 阅读科普类书籍是值得的。

sentences.english: This kind of books is usually written for children.
sentences.chinese: 这类书通常是为孩子们写的。？

definition: reference book (such as dictionary, almanac, gazetteer etc)
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
a series of books/a collection of books
the Twenty-Four Histories (25 or 26 in modern editions), collection of books on Chinese dynastic history from 3000 BC till 17th century/fig. a long and complicated story
name of a book/reputation as calligrapher
twenty four dynastic histories (or 25 or 26 in modern editions)
narrative history/comprehensive history/a history covering an extended period
